channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rich families try new tactics to prevent heirs from squandering wealth: ‘joyous’ vibes and escape rooms
item.description: Wealth managers use these techniques to help their clients avoid the 'third generation curse.'

item.title: With Stakes High, Lebanese Lawmakers to Try Again to Choose a President
item.description: Despite pressure by the United States and others to elect a president in order to receive financial support, a consensus candidate has yet to emerge w...

item.title: Ukraine Strikes Oil Depot Near Russian Air Base, Ukrainian Military Says
item.description: The attack was the latest effort to inflict pain on Russia even as Kyiv is losing ground on the battlefield at home.

item.title: Why Nvidia is betting on agentic AI use for enterprises
item.description: The tech giant is preparing for its next phase of growth.

item.title: With Stakes High, Lebanese Lawmakers to Try Again to Choose a President
item.description: Despite pressure by the United States and others to elect a president in order to receive financial support, a consensus candidate has yet to emerge w...

item.title: There’s a $32 trillion reason to bet big on women entrepreneurs as your 2025 investment resolution
item.description: Female entrepreneurs, long underserved by VCs, often recognize opportunities that have been hiding in plain sight.

item.title: Italy Says Cecilia Sala, Journalist Detained by Iran, Has Been Released
item.description: Cecilia Sala, 29, who was detained last month while on a reporting trip, was on a plane home, the Italian government announced.

item.title: What Is the U.K. ‘Grooming Gang’ Scandal Seized On by Elon Musk?
item.description: The billionaire tech mogul has been posting on his social media platform about a decade-old child sex abuse scandal in Britain. Here’s what to know.

item.title: Exclusive: Movement Labs set to close $100 million funding round as crypto markets heat up
item.description: Movement is building a layer-2 blockchain on Ethereum using technology from Facebook's failed crypto project.

item.title: Italy Says Cecilia Sala, Journalist Detained by Iran, Has Been Released
item.description: Cecilia Sala, 29, who was detained last month while on a reporting trip, was on a plane home, the Italian government announced.

item.title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet asks new hires what they’ve learned in the last 6 months: ‘If they can’t answer that question, we know they’re not a learner’
item.description: Julie Sweet wants workers to be ready to adapt amid AI's radical impact on the way we work.

item.title: Wildfires Roar Through L.A., and Trump Floats U.S. Expansion
item.description: Plus, the end of Facebook fact-checking.

item.title: Ukraine Strikes Oil Depot Near Russian Air Base, Ukrainian Military Says
item.description: The attack was the latest effort to inflict pain on Russia even as Kyiv is losing ground on the battlefield at home.

item.title: A Far-Right Government in Austria Would Be a Jolt, but Not Unexpected
item.description: The Freedom Party and its leader, Herbert Kickl, have steadily built support by demonizing immigrants, while entering Austria’s political mainstream.

item.title: Wildfires in Southern California
item.description: Plus, we explain why Facebook is getting rid of fact-checking.
